journal-title-group.journal-title: Journal of Money, Credit and Banking

title-group.article-title: Nonlinear Equilibrium Correction in U.S. Real Money Balances, 1869-1997

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2003 The Ohio State University Press

abstract.p: Several theoretical models of money demand imply nonlinear functional forms for the aggregate demand for money, characterized by smooth adjustment toward long-run equilibrium. In this paper, we propose a nonlinear equilibrium correction model of U.S. money demand that is shown to be stable over the sample period from 1869 to 1997.
